intro: Conophytum occultum, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves that store water. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. Conophytum occultum is known for its unique appearance and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
